title: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer mocks Manchester United squad with ‘Championship’ jibe
text:
Ole Gunnar Solskjaer fears for his job (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer tore into his squad after their ’embarassing’ defeat to Newcastle on Sunday and said Championship clubs were playing better football than his side.

The Red Devils managed just three shots on target against the Magpies and conceded late on thanks to a thunderous strike from Matty Longstaff.

With just two wins from their opening eight matches, United have made their worst start to a league campaign in 30 years and they face Liverpool at home after the international break.

The defeat against Steve Bruce’s men has ramped up the pressure on Solskjaer’s position and he fears the sack if United lost comfortable to Jurgen Klopp’s side at Old Trafford.

Solskjaer was furious with his side’s performance (Picture: Getty)

The situation is clearly getting to the normally-reserved Solskjaer and the Sun claim he tore into his players after their defeat on Sunday.

Solskjaer is said to have told the squad that they’re ’embarrassing’ themselves and that there are clubs in the Championship clubs playing better football than his side.

The Norwegian hopes his message will be the wake-up call that United need but the visit of Liverpool is looming large for the Red Devils.

United hope to have Paul Pogba, Jesse Lingard, Luke Shaw and Anthony Martial back for the game, while Victor Lindelof and Aaron Wan-Bissaka are only short-term absentees.

After Liverpool, United have three games away from home and they haven’t won away since March under Solskjaer.

Solskjaer described United’s performance in a 1-1 draw against Arsenal as ‘crap’ and called a 1-1 draw against Southampton in August a ‘joke’ after his side failed to make the 10-man Saints pay.
